sf:article.sf:title: Drive considerations on generation III devices

sf:abstract.sf:text: The author discusses the effects at turn-on of high voltage transistors and the implications on total device behavior in switch mode power supplies. After a general introduction of the switching cycle and its various phases there is an analysis into of each of the phases. The effects of using higher frequencies will be discussed and also the difference between the new generation BUS 133 and the older generationBIUS 13

sf:affiliation.sf:name: Semicond. Applications Lab., Philips Electronics., Mullard Hazel Grove UK
